item.title: Antony Blinken stuns with public criticism of Israeli conduct in Gaza
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday delivered some of the Biden administration’s strongest public criticism yet of Israel’s conduct of the war in Gaza, saying Israeli tactics have meant “a horrible loss of life of innocent civilians”.

item.title: Tide turns as Spain’s pro-union Socialists win regional elections
item.description: Six years after plunging Spain into its worst political crisis in decades, Catalonia's separatist parties are in danger of losing their hold on power in the north-eastern region after the pro-union Socialist Party scored a historic result in Sunday's election.

item.title: Putin appoints Sergei Shoigu as secretary of national security council
item.description: Read the latest developments in Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: Greek moderate conservatives set to win in EU elections
item.description: The local EPP affiliates of New Democracy are among the few ruling parties in the EU that are topping the polls in the European elections.

item.title: Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam. Japan’s Olympic selection shines, but Dicko looks unstoppable
item.description: The final day of the Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam in Astana saw the heavyweights take to the tatami inside the Zhaksylyk Ushkempirov Martial Arts Palace, searching for valuable ranking points for world championship and Olympic Games qualifications.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Israel attacks northern Gaza's Jabaliya refugee camp
item.description: Israeli military tanks have ventured into the camp after five Israeli soldiers were killed over the weekend.

item.title: Israeli police break up anti-government protest in Tel Aviv
item.description: The police pushed an anti-government demonstration away from a main traffic junction in the city using water canon and arresting some of the protestors.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russia bombards border city as major assault on Ukraine continues
item.description: Russia targets the border city of Vovchansk with intense airstrikes and rocket attacks as part of its major new assault on eastern Ukraine.

item.title: IDF says 'precise operation' in Rafah continues as thousands more told to evacuate
item.description: The Israeli military issued more evacuation orders for tens of thousand of Palestinians on Saturday, advising them to head to an ‘expanded humanitarian zone’ in al-Mawasi.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 12th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: European success with an Uzbek comeback
item.description: The second day of the Kazakhstan Barysy Grand Slam opened with a colourful ceremony featuring a range of cultural performances and remarks from the Deputy Prime Minister of Kazakhstan, the IJF director general, and the president of the Kazakhstan Judo Federation.

item.title: 'Extreme' solar storm triggers colourful light show around the world
item.description: The unusually strong solar storm hitting Earth produced stunning displays of colour in the skies across the Northern Hemisphere early Saturday.

item.title: Seven people die after a bus plunges off a bridge in St. Petersburg
item.description: A bus swerved off a bridge and descended into a river in St. Petersburg, killing seven people on Friday, Russian officials said.

item.title: Floods kill more than 300 people in northern Afghanistan, UN says
item.description: Flash floods from unusually heavy seasonal rains in Afghanistan have killed more than 300 people and destroyed over 1,000 houses, the U.N. food agency said Saturday.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 11th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: US announces 370 million euro package of weapons for Ukraine
item.description: Washington says it's intended, in part, to help Ukraine fend off the surging Russian effort to capture Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 11th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: ‘If the Russians go through Ukraine, do you think they won't go to Europe?’ - on Odesa’s front line
item.description: Dima runs a perfume shop in Odesa that has now doubled up as a place where volunteers can restock supplies. He told Euronews about how it is to be in close contact with those fighting on the frontline whilst trying to keep hope.

item.title: Israel orders fresh evacuations in Rafah despite US condemnation
item.description: All the latest developments from the Israel-Hamas war.

item.title: Judo Grand Slam day one: a golden start for Kazakhstan
item.description: All the latest developments on the Judo Grand Slam Astana 2024.

item.title: UN assembly approves resolution granting Palestine new rights
item.description: UN assembly approves resolution granting Palestine new rights and reviving its membership bid.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 10th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Poland: Europe's defence sentinel?
item.description: The Ukraine war and uncertainty about future US funding of NATO have rekindled fears about Europe's defence. Witness reporter Valerie Gauriat went to Poland to assess the potential for a spillover of the conflict into other parts of Europe and to gauge expectations of EU and NATO allies.

item.title: Terry Reintke: EU's Green Deal can be saved despite setbacks
item.description: With an unprecedented breakthrough, the Greens were among the surprise winners of the last European elections. Their ambitious climate agenda won over many voters. But COVID-19, the war in Ukraine, inflation and soaring energy costs have all taken a heavy toll on the movement's popularity

item.title: Putin reappoints technocrat prime minister as fifth term kicks off
item.description: Russian legislators will approve a new Putin cabinet in a rubber-stamp exercise following an election from which genuine opponents were excluded.

item.title: European elections: What do voters want? What have candidates pledged?
item.description: Watch episode seven of Euronews' guide to the European elections, taking place from June 6 to 9.

item.title: WATCH: Key European buildings are illuminated to mark Europe Day
item.description: Key buildings across the EU have been lit up to mark the upcoming European Elections.

item.title: Watch: Residential buildings catch fire following Russian strikes in Kharkiv
item.description: Residential buildings and houses were hit by Russian missiles in the city of Kharkiv, igniting fires and injuring two people, early Friday, according to local officials.

item.title: Lithuanian presidential vote nears under shadow of anxiety over Russia's plans
item.description: Popular incumbent, Gitanas Nausėda, is favoured to win another five-year term in a strategically important election for the Baltic region.

item.title: WATCH: Police disperse pro-Palestine protests at University of Amsterdam
item.description: Police broke up a protest by pro-Palestinian activists at the University of Amsterdam in a second straight day of unrest over the war in Gaza.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 10th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Armenians take to the streets asking PM Pashinyan to resign over border dispute
item.description: Protesters led by a senior cleric in Armenia's church walked a distance of around 160 kilometres from villages near the border with Azerbaijan to Yerevan, where they gathered Thursday in Republic Square.

item.title: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un commemorates death of chief propagandist
item.description: Kim Ki-nam led the effort to prop up North Korea's totalitarian dynasty with powerful cults of personality.

item.title: Chad declares military leader, Deby Itno, winner of disputed election
item.description: The results were contested by his main rival, Prime Minister Succès Masra.

item.title: Netanyahu says his country will 'fight with fingernails' if US curbs weapons
item.description: The Israeli prime minister says the country can ‘stand alone’ but hopes US and Israel can overcome differences.

item.title: Attica wildfire officials to face retrial
item.description: Twenty defendants in the 2018 Attica wildfires case will face retrial, after last month's controversial ruling, which saw only six people convicted over their roles in the disaster.

item.title: European Parliament president visits Kyiv on Europe Day
item.description: European Parliament President Robert Metsola addressed the International Summit of Cities and Regions in Kyiv on Thursday.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 9th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Huge gas fire rages through industrial estate in Thailand
item.description: A blaze at a chemical storage tank terminal in eastern Thailand prompted swift evacuation orders, according to the industry ministry.

item.title: WATCH: Russia celebrates 79th anniversary of victory over Nazi Germany
item.description: Russia on Thursday wrapped itself in patriotic pageantry for Victory Day, a celebration of its defeat of Nazi Germany in World War II.

item.title: Why the green light for Kosovo joining the Council of Europe is likely to be delayed
item.description: The Council of Europe's Committee of Ministers will not be making a decision on Kosovo membership in mid-May, according to their agenda. In the meantime, Pristina has been asked to fix the constitutional issue related to the Community of Serb Municipalities.

item.title: Boeing skids off runway at Senegal's main airport, injuring at least 10
item.description: At least 10 people were reportedly injured on the Air Sénégal flight headed to Bamako.

item.title: Axing the Oslo Accords killed the narrative, not just the process
item.description: Negating the Oslo peace process also rendered the “two peoples” narrative false. Observers were left with the conclusion that if the land “from the river and the sea” did not belong to two peoples, it belonged to one nation, Dr Shlomo Fischer writes.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 9th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Croatia's ruling conservatives embrace far-right party in new government
item.description: The ruling HDZ party took a major decision on Wednesday to form a coalition with a far-right nationalist party, signalling a shift towards the right as the European elections approach next month.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | May 9th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: US to stop some arms sales to Israel if Rafah offensive goes ahead, says Biden
item.description: Israel launched a ‘limited’ military operation into Rafah on Tuesday, seizing the crucial border crossing with Egypt.

item.title: Trade is at the heart of EU-China relations, experts say
item.description: A renewed focus on Beijing comes amid Chinese President Xi Jinping's European tour, at a time when China-EU ties are strained.
